content: stitch plus a few extras  row 1 3 5 & 7 ws * p1 k1 * repeat between ** to last st p1  row 2 4 & 6 *k1 p1 * repeat between ** to last st k1  row 8 rs with larger needles k1 p1 k7 8 9 10 11 sts kfb pm kfb k6 6 6 8 8 kfb pm kfb k21 23 25 27 29 sts kfb pm kfb k6 6 6 8 8 sts kfb pm kfb k7 8 9 10 11 p1 k1 67 71 75 83 87 sts  row 9 & all odd row p1 k1 purl to last 2 sts k1 p1  row 10 & all even row k1 p1 knit to last 2 sts p1 k1 increasing before and after each marker as established in row 8 until 155 159 163 171 183 sts are on needle end on wrong side a total of 12 increase row will be worked for first 4 sizes and 13 increase row for the last size  with rs facing k1 p1 k20 21 22 23 25 across to 1st marker right back place next 32 32 32 34 36 sts on holder sleeve co 2 sts k across 47 49 51 53 57 sts front place next 32 32 32 34 36 sts on holder sleeve co 2 sts k20 21 22 23 25 across to last 2sts p1 k1 left back 95 99 103 107 115 sts  work in stockinette stitch with 1x1 ribbing at edges as establised until piece measures 5 5 7 7 7 5 inches from underarm  change to smaller needles k1 p1 rib pattern for 1 inch bind off in pattern sleeves work one at a time or both at the same time with separate balls of yarn or yarn coming from the outside and inside of one skein  with larger needles slide stitches from holder s onto needle  with rs facing k2 kfb k to last 3sts kfb k2  work in stockinette stitch for 4 5 6 6 6 5 inches or desired length  change to smaller needles and k1 p1 rib pattern for 1inch bind off finishing  sew sleeve seams i recommend the mattress stitch and weave in loose ends  sew in zipper place closed end at top of hood leaving open end at bottom of sweater i recommend the backstitch using the purl stitch as a guideline for the stitching abbreviations co- cast on cont continue k knit kfb knit in front & back of stitch p purl pm place marker rs right side st s stitch es stitch glossary  stockinette stitch knit 1 row purl 1 row repeat to create stockinette stitch pattern  k1 p1 rib 1x1 rib with yarn in back *k1 bring yarn to back views front under the right hand needle and purl the next stitch bring yarn to back under the right hand needle * repeat between
